Join us for the fourth installment of our five-part event series to learn from experts at the forefront of the battle against systems of injustice.

Tuesday, September 22, 6:30 – 7:30 p.m.
Zoom
Details provided upon registration

RSVP Today


The topic of the evening will be, "The Society." Our society tends to push people and communities experiencing poverty and the criminal legal system to the fringes, creating isolation that prevents the development of valuable social capital. This session will examine this phenomenon, and we will discuss how to disrupt this cycle.

Speakers: Senior Field Organizer for the ACLU-PA Campaign for Smart Justice Terrell Thomas and Executive Director of Circles of Greater Pittsburgh Halima Tammy Thompson.

Moderator: Assistant Professor of Social Work at Chatham University Marcus Poindexter.

Questions? Email pghinfo@aclupa.org or call (412) 681-7736.
